text: <!channel> Did anyone else have their Spyder/Anaconda/Pycharm just spontaneously uninstall at some point in these last few weeks?
<@U1L6WB44A> yes. after I updated my laptop it just uninstalled. I had to reinstall it  - no idea why that happened though
I bet good money on Windows 10 updates...  I had it uninstall a couple other programs on me about a week ago, but not python.
Has anyone gotten the basic "NLTK Term Vectors" script from class to run?  I'm getting errors with the required packages, even after installing gensim with pip.
I cant get gensim running. How do you add new modules?
Hey Ed--Andrea sent us an email about it.  If you go to Anaconda Command Prompt and type 'pip install gensim' it should install
Thanks <@U1KRNTXL5>   I'm still working on getting my files read in, so not to the point of actually using gensim yet.
<@U1KRNTXL5> have you tried installing nltk in command prompt with 'pip install nltk'
<@U1KVBARR9> I got it to work finally...there was a missing package in nltk called upunkt (or something like that--who comes up with these things?)
<@U1KRNTXL5>:  you need to run nltk.download(). Then you can download subsidiary packages. Best done in command line, though you can run a script and an interactive window will appear.
was anyone able to download the additional components using nltk.download() ?
Try opening anaconda prompt and typing 'pip install nltk'
that tells me I already have NLTK installed, but nltk.download() still doesn't do anything
